signals.title: FCC Votes to Unlock High-Power 6 GHz for Wi-Fi and IoT Devices
signals.summary: The FCC is creating a new 'geofenced variable power' (GVP) device category in the 6 GHz band to enable higher-power outdoor operations while protecting licensed users. This contrasts with Europe's approach of reserving 6 GHz for mobile services, with the U.S. 'doubling down on unlicensed access' to accelerate AR/VR, IoT, and indoor navigation innovations.
key_facts: New GVP device category uses geographic restrictions to prevent interference
Enables outdoor, longer-range wireless beyond current low-power indoor devices
U.S. strategy diverges from European mobile-focused 6 GHz allocation
Targets next-generation AR/VR and IoT use cases

signals.title: NVIDIA and US Telecom Leaders Unveil All-American AI-RAN Stack for 6G
signals.summary: NVIDIA and partners (Booz Allen, Cisco, MITRE, ODC, T-Mobile) have developed America's first AI-native wireless stack for 6G networks. The system achieved breakthrough performance: 7x greater cell capacity and 3.5x higher power efficiency compared to legacy RAN. Features include multimodal ISAC (camera vision + RF sensing), AI-powered spectrum agility, and real-time spectrum sensing for interference detection.
key_facts: First AI-native wireless stack for 6G in the U.S.
7x cell capacity improvement over legacy systems
Multimodal ISAC fuses camera and RF sensing

signals.title: Starlink Secures FCC Approval to Launch 7,500 Additional LEO Satellites
signals.summary: SpaceX received FCC clearance to deploy 7,500 Gen2 Starlink satellites (bringing total to 15,000), operating in multiple frequency bands (Ku-, Ka-, V-, E-, W-band) at altitudes 340km-485km. The FCC stated this enables 'gigabit speed service, including symmetrical download and upload speeds.' Gen3 satellites with 1+ Tbps capacity await Starship rocket availability (expected H1 2026).
key_facts: Operates Ku-, Ka-, V-, E-, W-band frequencies
Gen3 satellites: 1+ Tbps capacity, launching H1 2026

signals.title: BT Group Partners with Starlink for Rural Satellite Broadband (2026 Launch)
signals.summary: BT Group signed partnership with SpaceX's Starlink to offer satellite broadband via EE consumer brand, launching in select rural UK areas in H2 2026. Starlink's 8,800-satellite constellation provides UK-wide coverage with advertised speeds up to 280 Mbps (median ~86 Mbps). BT aims to reach underserved populations where fiber isn't economically viable, complementing its 20.3M FTTP premises.
key_facts: Launch: H2 2026 in select rural UK areas

signals.title: AT&T's $14B Open RAN Deployment Targets 70% Traffic by 2026
signals.summary: AT&T committed $14 billion over 5 years with Ericsson to achieve 70% of network traffic on open platforms by 2026. Cloud RAN deployment inflection point expected in 2026. Strategy enables 'continuous innovation' decoupled from generational cycles. Trials in Red Oak (TX), Atlanta, and Memphis focus on scaling challenges. Annual RAN power costs: ~$1 billion, targeting efficiency improvements.
key_facts: Target: 70% traffic on open platforms by 2026
Trials: Red Oak TX, Atlanta, Memphis
Focus: 5G SA expansion, network APIs, energy efficiency

signals.title: Verizon Launches 5G Network Slice for Enterprise FWA
signals.summary: Verizon introduced '5G Network Slice - Enhanced Internet' for enterprises (500+ employees), providing dedicated C-band capacity with SLAs and enhanced uplink for cloud/AI workloads. Service targets business-critical operations requiring solid uplink performance for AI inference, computer vision, and machine learning applications. Marks commercialization acceleration for network slicing in 2026.
key_facts: Dedicated C-band spectrum slice with SLAs
Enhanced uplink capacity for cloud/AI workloads
Use cases: AI inference, computer vision, ML
Part of 2026 network slicing commercialization wave

signals.title: T-Mobile Plans Dynamic Network Slicing Launch Early 2026
signals.summary: T-Mobile announced plans to launch dynamic network slicing in early 2026, enabling customers to 'create end-to-end slices on the T-Mobile network with just a credit card.' All three major U.S. operators expected to offer nationwide network slices in 2026. Market projections: 5G slicing to exceed $20 billion by 2026, with industrial manufacturing, C-V2X, and logistics generating ~$12 billion.
key_facts: Self-service creation 'with just a credit card'
All 3 major U.S. carriers launching slices in 2026
85+ operators with commercial 5G SA by end 2025

signals.title: Samsung's Private 5G Networks Support Digital Transformation with RedCap
signals.summary: Samsung's virtualized private 5G platform consolidates DU, CU, UPF, and virtual switch in 'Network in a Server' architecture. Supports RedCap devices with simplified 5G modems for smaller form factors, reduced cost, and extended battery life. Demonstrated with Hyundai Motor integrating RedCap into vehicle inspection automation. Applications include AGVs, remote cranes, autonomous transport, inspection robots, and 5G CCTV.
key_facts: Consolidated architecture: DU+CU+UPF in single server
RedCap: Simplified 5G modems, smaller form factors
Use cases: AGVs, remote cranes, inspection robots
Cloud deployment models for reduced CapEx

signals.title: CIMPOR Completes Ericsson Private 5G Rollout at Portugal Cement Plants
signals.summary: CIMPOR, multinational cement producer, activated Ericsson Private 5G Mobile Private Network (MPN) across three Portugal cement production units in partnership with Vodafone Portugal. Represents industrial enterprise adoption trend, with annual private 5G investments projected to grow at 41% CAGR 2025-2028, reaching $5B+ by 2028. Production-grade deployments by Airbus, Ford, Toyota, Walmart, and others.
key_facts: Deployment: 3 cement production units in Portugal
Industrial adopters: Airbus, Ford, Toyota, Walmart, Tesla

signals.title: Direct-to-Device Satellite: AT&T Beta Launch with AST SpaceMobile in H1 2026
signals.summary: AT&T plans beta D2D satellite service in H1 2026 with AST SpaceMobile for select consumer and FirstNet public safety users, following AST's BlueBird 6 satellite launch (December 2025). AST expects 'intermittent nationwide' service early 2026, 'continuous' service later in year. Five BlueBird launches planned by Q1 2026. 3GPP Release 19 (expected 2027) will standardize D2D for voice/real-time comms (commercial 2028).
key_facts: Target: Select consumers + FirstNet public safety

signals.title: Starlink Direct-to-Cell Exits Beta, Achieves 15-20 Mbps on Unmodified 5G Phones
signals.summary: SpaceX announced at CES 2026 that Starlink Direct-to-Cell officially exited beta and is now live for unmodified 5G phones across partner carriers (T-Mobile USA, KDDI Japan, Optus Australia). CES demos showed 15-20 Mbps downlink speeds, sufficient for HD video streaming and full web browsing in total dead zones. Samsung Galaxy S26 series features Exynos 6000 chipset with native NTN modem for 2-way SMS and photo sharing (Skylo/Telesat Lightspeed).
key_facts: HD video streaming capable in dead zones

signals.title: FCC Sets June 2026 for AWS-3 Spectrum Auction (Auction 113)
signals.summary: FCC scheduled AWS-3 Auction 113 deadline for June 23, 2026. Filing window for interested parties opens January 26, 2026; upfront pre-bidding payments due April 8, 2026. Separately, FCC advancing upper C-band (3.98-4.2 GHz) auction rulemaking for up to 180 MHz, targeting 5G/6G services. OBBBA requires upper C-band auction completion by July 2027. This represents critical mid-band spectrum expansion for 5G-to-6G transition.
key_facts: FCC voted November 20, 2025 to advance rulemaking

signals.title: RedCap and eRedCap Module Launches Expected Throughout 2026
signals.summary: RedCap commercial devices entered market in 2025-2026 after chipset availability in 2023-2024. Enhanced RedCap (eRedCap) scheduled for commercial rollout in 2026, enabling smoother LTE category transitions. 30 operators across 21 countries investing (China Mobile, China Telecom, China Unicom, Dito, STC, T-Mobile US). AT&T announced complete nationwide RedCap coverage July 2025. GCF-certified modules emerging throughout 2025-2026.
key_facts: Operators: China Mobile/Telecom/Unicom, Dito, STC, T-Mobile
Target: Wearables, industrial sensors, video surveillance
Bridges gap between low-power IoT and full 5G

signals.title: Wi-Fi 7 Access Point Shipments Projected to Reach 117.9M in 2026
signals.summary: Wi-Fi 7 AP shipments jumped from 26.3M (2024) to 66.5M (2025), with ABI Research forecasting 117.9M in 2026. Enterprise adoption accelerating faster than previous generations, with Wi-Fi 7 becoming 'default refresh' for new enterprise AP purchases. Wi-Fi Alliance forecasts 1.1B total Wi-Fi 7 device shipments in 2026 (including 196.1M IoT, 22.3M healthcare, 159.4M consumer devices). 38% of survey respondents plan 2026 deployments.

signals.title: Wi-Fi Alliance Introduces 20 MHz-Only Wi-Fi 7 Certification (January 2026)
signals.summary: Wi-Fi Alliance introduced new Wi-Fi Certified 7 certification option for client devices operating exclusively on 20 MHz channels (January 2026). This extends next-generation Wi-Fi 7 features to broader classes of connected products including residential, enterprise, and industrial devices. Enables Wi-Fi 7 adoption for bandwidth-constrained devices that don't require full wide-channel capabilities.
key_facts: Extends Wi-Fi 7 to broader device classes

signals.title: Open RAN Poised for 2026 Surge Despite 2025 Turbulence
signals.summary: Industry experts expect 2026 as year of 'meaningful open RAN scaling,' driven by European operators. 31% of MNOs planning near-RT RIC deployment by 2026; 35% planning RIC for all Open RAN operations. Deutsche Telekom targets 3,000 'O-RAN compatible' sites (5% of antennas) by 2026. Open RAN transitioning from promising concept to scalable, commercially viable reality, though RIC technology still maturing.
key_facts: 2026: Year of meaningful Open RAN scaling
31% of MNOs deploying near-RT RIC by 2026
35% planning RIC for all Open RAN operations
RIC technology in plug fests and trials

signals.title: 6G Standardization Timeline: 3GPP Release 21 Specs Decided by June 2026
signals.summary: 6G standards discussions started earnestly in early 2025, with clearer picture expected by end 2026. First 6G specifications in 3GPP Release 21, with timeline for spec work decided by June 2026. Commercial 6G services anticipated ~2030. ETSI workshop (April 2025) brought O-RAN Alliance and 3GPP together for 6G open RAN discussions. 5G Advanced capabilities evolving to 6G: ML integration in RAN/core, energy efficiency, low latency, advanced MIMO, satellite integration.
key_facts: Key features: ML in RAN/core, energy efficiency
Also: Low latency, advanced MIMO, satellite integration

signals.title: Quantum-Safe 5G: QORE Framework Enables Post-Quantum Cryptography Transition
signals.summary: QORE framework engineered to transition 5G core networks to post-quantum cryptography, addressing quantum computing threats. Utilizes NIST-standardized lattice-based algorithms (ML-KEM, ML-DSA) across 5G Service-Based Architecture. Research shows ML-KEM achieves robust security with minimal performance overhead, meeting carrier-grade 5G low-latency/high-throughput requirements. RSA ciphers projected to be broken before 2030, creating urgency for quantum-resistant migration.
key_facts: QORE: Post-quantum crypto for 5G core networks

signals.title: eSIM Device Shipments to Exceed 633M in 2026 Driven by China and SGP.32
signals.summary: ABI Research forecasts eSIM-enabled device shipments exceeding 633M in 2026, driven by Chinese smartphone adoption and SGP.32 standard advancements across consumer and IoT markets. Enterprise eSIM demand growing faster than consumer travel use, prioritizing reliability, visibility, security over ease/pricing. By 2026, eSIM/iSIM are 'default expectations' in many RFPs. Android/iOS integrating network slicing support for enterprise IT routing to dedicated corporate slices.
key_facts: Key drivers: China adoption, SGP.32 standard
Enterprise demand growing faster than consumer
eSIM/iSIM default in IoT RFPs by 2026
Enterprise IT routing to corporate slices
Growing separation of consumer vs. enterprise needs

signals.title: Ericsson Publishes Indoor 5G Neutral Host Deployment Framework (2026)
signals.summary: Ericsson released indoor 5G neutral host guidebook covering practical considerations and five-stage deployment framework. Neutral host market may reach $8.7B by 2028, driven by indoor data traffic and private network adoption (manufacturing, education, healthcare, retail). Three architecture models: Site Sharing, Shared Radio, Shared RAN. CBRS-enabled shared spectrum MOCN model 'gaining prominence in U.S.' Verizon revealed first 5G neutral host private networking product (Cummins deal).
key_facts: Architecture: Site Sharing, Shared Radio, Shared RAN
Technologies: DAS, small cells, Open RAN, virtualization

signals.title: Global FTTH Deployment Enters New Growth Cycle in 2026
signals.summary: FTTH development entering new growth cycle in 2026, with operators in Europe, Latin America, Middle East, and Africa accelerating deployments for higher speeds, low-latency apps, and next-gen PON upgrades. Pre-terminated solutions can halve installation costs and accelerate deployment 70%, especially urban areas. Industry needs 28,000 additional broadband construction workers and 30,000 more technicians. Most U.S. states starting BEAD program deployments in 2026.
key_facts: Regions: Europe, Latin America, Middle East, Africa
Target: Higher speeds, low-latency, next-gen PON

signals.title: SoftBank's $4B DigitalBridge Investment Signals AI Infrastructure Pivot
signals.summary: SoftBank Group's $4B move into DigitalBridge reflects strategic pivot from speculative, asset-light tech investments toward owning physical AI economy backbone. 26North Partners in advanced talks to acquire DigitalBridge Group Inc. (parent of Vertical Bridge). DigitalBridge closed third value-added digital infrastructure fund (Partners III) with $7.2B+ in commitments. IEA forecasts global data-center electricity demand could double by 2026, driven by AI training/inference.
key_facts: Shift to physical AI infrastructure ownership
IEA: Data center demand could double by 2026

signals.title: MediaTek and Qualcomm Launch Next-Gen 5G Modems with Satellite and 10 Gbps+ at MWC 2025
signals.summary: MediaTek announced M90 modem at MWC 2025 with 3GPP NTN/IoT-NR satellite connectivity and Modem AI 2.0 (usage pattern recognition, device orientation optimization). Qualcomm countered with X85 modem powering Dragonwing FWA Gen 4 Elite (40 TOPS NPU for 5G AI) and X82 for mainstream applications. Both break 10 Gbps barrier using AI and satellite functionality. MediaTek market share: 29.2% (from 22.8%); Qualcomm: 26.5% (from 31.2%).
key_facts: Modem AI 2.0: Pattern recognition, orientation optimization
Qualcomm X85: 40 TOPS NPU, FWA Gen 4 Elite

signals.title: Dish Network Decommissions 5G, Sells Spectrum to AT&T, Becomes MVNO
signals.summary: Dish Network announced 2025 decommissioning of its 5G network infrastructure, selling most wireless spectrum to AT&T, and shifting Boost Mobile from facilities-based network to MVNO on AT&T's network. Complete reversal of T-Mobile-Sprint merger conditions designed to maintain four nationwide competitors. Original 2019 deal: Dish bought Boost/Virgin/Sprint prepaid for $1.4B plus $3.6B in 800 MHz spectrum, with 7-year T-Mobile network access during buildout. All merger critics' predictions (layoffs, price hikes, reduced competition) came true.
key_facts: Boost Mobile: Facilities-based → MVNO on AT&T

signals.title: Terahertz Research Breakthroughs for 6G: J-Band Testbed at 220-330 GHz
signals.summary: Researchers at SUNY Polytechnic Institute and Florida International University claimed terahertz breakthroughs for 6G networks. Built J-band terahertz testbed (220-330 GHz) studying ultra-high frequency signal behavior, finding THz waves exhibit extended near-field region and asymmetrical uplink-downlink behavior. D-band (110-170 GHz) identified as promising 6G frequency. THz technology supports 100 Gbps to Tbps-level data rates (100-1000x faster than 5G). Global 6G market poised for $500M-$1B (2026) to $150B-$300B (2036).
key_facts: THz data rates: 100 Gbps to Tbps
